projects.title: Uniworld Logistics
projects.subTitle: Visual Identity Revamp for one of Asia’s largest independent providers of freight and supply chain solutions.
projects.description:
For Uniworld Logistics, communicating the legacy of two decades was as important as their foray into the future. The brand exercise and its visual extension capture the essence of the legacy meeting the future seamlessly.

The new visual imagery is inspired by the core story of 'United, We Move' with a bold color palette inspired by the modes of transportation. The design system consists of vertical and horizontal traingles , derived from the W of the logo mark, signifying movement and solutions in every aspects of Logistics.

projects.title: Sacmar
projects.subTitle: Brand Overhaul for the Italian flavour maker, Sacmar
projects.description:
Since 1940 Sacmar produces essential oils and raw materials for the flavour industry. With more than 1.000 of flavours created over the years for the food, nutraceutical, pharmaceutical and oral hygiene industries, Sacmar has grown to be one of the highest ranked producer in the market.

The refreshed wordmark draws inspiration from Sacmar’s unique fusion of technology and the creativity of its herbalists, seamlessly combining bold, straight lines with elegant, flowing curves. This design evokes a sense of dynamic, continuous motion, propelling the brand forward.

Colourful gradients were designed as a conceptual and visual extension of Sacmar’s brand identity, crafting a coherent yet diverse imagery.

Flavor kaleidoscopes act as key visuals and dynamic backgrounds, formed by blending these gradients with organic shapes derived from the Sacmar logo. As a versatile and visually striking element, they add depth and sophistication to marketing materials and digital platforms.

projects.title: Oltre
projects.subTitle: Visual Identity design for a high-end therapy clinic based in Milan, Italy
projects.description:
Oltre cares to become a reference for those who want to put change, personal growth, overcoming difficulties related to emotional suffering and wellbeing at the center of their lives.

In a market where psychotherapy offerings are increasingly being positioned in terms of accessibility, Oltre positions itself in the opposite vertex, formulating the best possible path to their clients.

The developed visual imagery consists of a color palette with hues of blues, inspired from the interiors of the space, complemented by a serif-sans serif typography using Hedvig Letters serif and sans by Google fonts. To reflect the nature of their offering, an ample amount of whitespace is used as a key design element across all communication.

projects.title: Romarì
projects.subTitle: Organic hand drawn illustrations for the Brand Identity of Romarì
projects.description:
Romarì is an Italian manufacturing company that produces and sells fragrances, essential oils, natural extracts and flavoring for the food and personal care product industries. The company work in partnership with agricultural businesses and certified suppliers around the world to produce unique solutions.

Organic and hand-drawn illustration style was chosen as a part of the visual identity system to reflect the brand values: transparency, respect for people and the environment. For this purpose, a range of compositions were envisioned and brought to life illustrating scenarios of product application. These illustrations were developed using mixed production techniques combining analog and digital means.

projects.title: 36 days of type
projects.subTitle: Establishing my illustration style drawing letters and numbers
projects.description:
36 Days of Type is a project that invites designers, illustrators and graphic artists to express their particular interpretation of the letters and numbers of the Latin alphabet.

A yearly open call exploring the creative boundaries of letterforms, where participants are challenged to design a letter or number each day for 36 consecutive days. For this edition, I tried to explore and develop my illustration style. I'm a fan of things that are natural and organic and tried to reflect it in my works by giving my illustrations a handrawn look.

projects.title: Personal Archive
projects.subTitle: A collection of Illustrations
projects.description: Some illustrations from my personal archive. I've always sketched random things since childhood, but didn't know if they were good enough to illustrate or produce them for personal/commercial purposes and to show myself as an artist/ Illustrator. Good feedback from my friends/peers made me digitise them. The following pages contain some outputs from my sketchbook archive. There are a lot that I haven't digitised yet. Hoping to do them in my free time. My illustrations are a reflection of my personality-fun to be with- and the way my brain works - overthinking about any and every situation visualizing endless possibilities.
